snippet: An affiliate has taken root in the chaos of a civil war, apparently determined to distinguish itself as Yemen’s most disruptive and brutal force.
abstract: Nine-month conflict in Yemen between Houthi rebels and Saudi-led coalition has empowered new affiliate of Islamic State; jihadist group's rise and sheer brutality has drawn defectors from country's Al Qaeda branch and complicated upcoming United Nations-brokered peace talks.

byline.original: By SHUAIB ALMOSAWA, KAREEM FAHIM and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Shuaib Almosawa reported from Sana, Kareem Fahim from Cairo, and Eric Schmitt from Washington. Saeed Al-Batati contributed reporting from Al Mukalla, Yemen.

lead_paragraph: An affiliate has taken root in the chaos of a civil war, apparently determined to distinguish itself as Yemen’s most disruptive and brutal force.

headline.main: Islamic State Gains Strength in Yemen, Challenging Al Qaeda
headline.print_headline: Violence Escalates in Yemen as Islamic State Gains Strength, Challenging Al Qaeda

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
